text: NDEP Logo National Diabetes Education Program (NDEP) was started by the NIH and CDC in 1997 to educate the public about the risks of diabetes. NDEP's goal is to reduce the illness and death caused by diabetes and its complications. To help meet this goal, NDEP provides free diabetes education information to the public. ==References== ==External links== *National Diabetes Education Program Category:National Institutes of Health
title: National Diabetes Education Program
